text: In abstract algebra, Krull's separation lemma is a lemma in ring theory. It was proved by Wolfgang Krull in 1928. ==Statement of the lemma== Let I be an ideal and let M be a multiplicative system (i.e. M is closed under multiplication) in a ring R, and suppose I \cap M = \varnothing. Then there exists a prime ideal P satisfying I \subseteq P and P \cap M = \varnothing. ==References== Category:Ring theory Category:Theorems in abstract algebra Category:Lemmas
title: Krull's separation lemma
